channel.title: 43 Folders
channel.itunes:author: Merlin Mann
channel.description: 43 Folders is Merlin Mann?s site about personal productivity, life hacks, and simple ways to make your life a little better. We have a Mothership site, a community-driven wiki, and a lively Google Group where geeks like to congregate and swap tips on navigating our overloaded world.
channel.itunes:summary: 43 Folders podcasts on personal productivity, life hacks, and simple ways to make your life a little better.
channel.itunes:subtitle: 43 Folders podcasts on personal productivity, life hacks, and simple ways to make your life a little better.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: Kung Fu, Meditation, and Sexual Intercourse
item.description:
There’s as rich a body of literature about (and tools for) Productivity as most any subject you can imagine.

To avoid becoming an unproductive dilettante, make sure your practice of Productivity always takes precedence over your talmudic scholarship on the subject.

AKA: All the reading in the world won’t teach you as much as your first french kiss.

(Running Time: 03:47)
item.itunes:author: 43 Folders
item.author: podcast@43folders.com (Merlin Mann)

item.title: Macworld: Jason Snell and John Gruber on iPhone applications
item.description: Merlin talks with MacWorld Magazine’s Jason Snell and DaringFireball.net’s John Gruber about the likely future of applications for the recently announced iPhone. Who will be allowed to play? How does it affect the ostensible competition? Will this end up feeling more like an phone with an iPod, a Mac with a phone, or something altogether different? (5:48)

item.title: Productive Talk Comp.: Episodes 01-08
item.description:
This is a compilation of the eight podcast episodes of Productive Talk which ran on 43folders.com and davidco.com in the fall of 2006. (1h:26m)

  • Episode 1: Procrastination
  • Episode 2: Patching Leaks
  • Episode 3: The Someday Maybe List
  • Episode 4: GTD for Teams
  • Episode 5: Email
  • Episode 6: Interruptions
  • Episode 7: Implementing GTD
  • Episode 8: GTD 2.0?
More at http://www.davidco.com/ & http://www.43folders.com/ Note: An enhanced, AAC version of this podcast (with chapters for iPod browsing) is available for download at 43 Folders.
item.itunes:author: 43 Folders
item.author: podcast@43folders.com (Merlin Mann)

item.itunes:summary: This is a compilation of the eight podcast episodes of Productive Talk which ran on 43folders.com and davidco.com in the fall of 2006. (1h:26m) Episode 1: Procrastination Episode 2: Patching Leaks Episode 3: The Someday Maybe List Episode 4: GTD for Teams Episode 5: Email Episode 6: Interruptions Episode 7: Implementing GTD Episode 8: GTD 2.0? More at http://www.davidco.com/ & http://www.43folders.com/ Note: An enhanced, AAC version of this podcast (with chapters for iPod browsing) is available for download at 43 Folders.

item.title: Productive Talk #08: GTD 2.0?
item.description:
In this episode, Merlin asks David one of the most popular questions about GTD; if he could write the book all over again today, what would he do differently? David addresses how people’s understanding of GTD evolves on repeated exposures, as well hinting at future plans for making GTD easier for people to start and maintain. He makes some great points on learning to pay attention to your “higher altitudes,” and wraps up by underscoring the importance of not having to rethink every task throughout the day. (13:11)

More at: http://www.davidco.com/ & http://www.43folders.com/

item.title: Productive Talk #07: Implementing GTD
item.description:
In this episode, David and Merlin look at best practices for implementing Getting Things Done. David shares some great advice on firewalling review time and warns us how to avoid the perils of “cruise control.” (9:37)

More at: http://www.davidco.com/ and http://www.43folders.com/

item.title: Productive Talk #06: Interruptions
item.description:
In this episode David and I talked about interruptions. How you can minimize the bad interruptions and make the best of the good ones. (10:17)

More at: http://www.davidco.com/ http://www.43folders.com/

item.title: Productive Talk #05: Email
item.description:
In this episode David and Merlin talk about email. We learn that David coaches people to deal with a high volume of messages by treating them like you would any other input.

More at: http://www.davidco.com/ http://www.43folders.com/

item.title: Productive Talk #04: Teams
item.description:
In this episode, David and Merlin talk about the role of GTD in teams and how to lead by example.

More at: http://www.davidco.com/ and http://www.43folders.com/

item.title: Productive Talk #03: Someday Maybe
item.description: In this episode, David and Merlin talk about how people use their someday/maybe list, as well as look at some ways you can make best use of your project list and support materials. David also makes a case for capturing 100% of whatever has your attention. (10:22)

item.title: Productive Talk #02: Patching Leaks
item.description: In this episode, David and Merlin talked about ways to patch the leaks in your GTD system—including the role of ubiquitous capture and scrupulous review. (10:33)

item.title: Productive Talk #01: Procrastination
item.description:
In this episode, David and Merlin talk about a very popular topic on 43 Folders—procrastination. They discuss where procrastination comes from and how GTD can help get you back to cranking widgets.

More at: http://www.davidco.com/ http://www.43folders.com/

item.title: Work the Dash and Take the Break
item.description: 43folders.com – To make the “(10+2)*5 Procrastination Dash” work, you have to actually take the break. Make a modal change, get away from the computer, and catch up on your neighbors’ mail. (2:04)

item.title: The Richard Scarry Book of the Future
item.description: 43folders.com – Vocational wheel in the sky keeps on turning. Where do we find the skills we need to succeed today, and why do they call it “Nursing?”

item.title: Honor Thy Energy
item.description: 43folders.com – Learn the times you’re most energetic and productive, and adjust your schedule and your work accordingly. Also: please just let the teenagers sleep, for God’s sake.

item.title: Fresh Starts & Modest Changes
item.description: 43 Folders – As an antidote to the surfeit of New Year’s resolutions, we’ll be looking into smaller, less dramatic adjustments (that don’t require a drunken promise or a pointy paper hat). Our series starts Wednesday.

item.title: The Myth of Multi-tasking
item.description: 43Folders.com – “Multi-taskers” are really just splitting their time and attention into smaller slices than you; no one can really do more than one thing at a time. (2:34)

item.title: The 'to have done list'
item.description: Don’t get freaked out by the items on your to-do list; think of the tasks in terms of what they’ll mean to you once they’re done.
